name: Ellipsis Issue 1
description: “A wry yet heartfelt examination of the subtext whenever anyone says ‘the journey’s more important than the destination’” - Kieron Gillen (Phonogram, Journey into Mystery) El•lip•sis (noun) From Ancient Greek (elleipsis) to leave out, fall short 1. A mark or series of marks used to indicate an intentional omission, unfinished thought or a trailing off into silence. The ellipsis can also inspire a feeling of melancholy or longing. 2. A sudden leap from one topic to another. 3. A comic composed of six standalone but interconnected short stories by Tom Humberstone Issue 1/6 Pregnant Pause. A young woman contemplates the transient and incongruous nature of airports as she begins a new chapter of her life. 24 pages with a die-cut cover. The first 100 pre-orders receive an additional signed and numbered A5 colour print. Select the "With sketch" option to receive your copy signed and with a unique sketch by the artist. Half page. Fully inked. Images can be requested by using the Contact link and emailing Solipsistic Pop Books. Download a PDF Press Release. Published on July 27th 2012 by Solipsistic Pop Books, London ISBN 978-0-9570519-1-1

name: Ellipsis (subscription)
description: “A wry yet heartfelt examination of the subtext whenever anyone says ‘the journey’s more important than the destination’” - Kieron Gillen (Phonogram, Journey into Mystery) El•lip•sis (noun) From Ancient Greek (elleipsis) to leave out, fall short 1. A mark or series of marks used to indicate an intentional omission, unfinished thought or a trailing off into silence. The ellipsis can also inspire a feeling of melancholy or longing. 2. A sudden leap from one topic to another. 3. A comic composed of six standalone but interconnected short stories by Tom Humberstone This subscription ensures you receive every issue before anyone else and entitles you to additional print incentives, original artwork and more. The subscription exists as a way to provide a 'readership advance' for the artist to focus exclusively on the series. More about this has been written here. Subscribe to Ellipsis to receive: - All 6 issues of the comic before they are released in stores. Signed and with a sketch. Each issue will ship every six months. - All postage and packing included in the initial cost (International subscribers pay slightly more in order to contribute to shipping costs). - Digital copies of each comic. - Every additional, signed and numbered print incentive that comes with each issue (while stocks last - if prints have sold out, an alternative sketch/postcard will be provided). - The collected edition of the comic. - A newsletter with updates on Ellipsis. - Exclusive opportunities to purchase and win original art from the series. Download a PDF Press Release of Issue 1.

name: Solipsistic Pop Four
description:
Book Four of Solipsistic Pop is the largest and most ambitious volume yet – with 80 pages, 30 artists, a larger print-run of 1,000, and extensive interactive material that makes full use of the joy of the printed artefact.

The theme for Book Four is Maps and each contributor has created a comic inspired by the visual vocabulary of cartography, circuit diagrams and flowcharts.

A large folder designed by John Miers houses the book and additional elements - including three postcards that have been specially printed to encourage the reader to travel with their comics. A local-area bingo checklist by Oliver East, a glow-in-the-dark comic by Takayo Akiyama, and a plantable seeded comic by Jenny Robins.

A wraparound book cover by Stephen Collins is protected by a large A2 poster/dustjacket designed by Katie Green.

Featured artists: Takayo Akiyama / Kristyna Baczynski / Dan Berry / Joe Blann / Stephen Collins / Paul Harrison Davis / Joe Decie / John Cei Douglas / Oliver East / Nick Edwards / Marc Ellerby / Paul Francis, Katie Green / Isabel Greenberg / Howard Hardiman / Ste Hitchen / Tom Humberstone / Joe List / Lizz Lunney / John Miers / Kathryn Newman / Luke Pearson / Philippa Rice / Jenny Robins / Edward Ross / Alison Sampson / Anna Saunders / Matthew Sheret

ISBN: 978-0-9570519-0-4

name: 100 Days (eBook)
description: Conceived by comedian Josie long, One Hundred Days to Make Me a Better Person was an online project which launched on 1st Dec 2009 and ran until 10th March 2010. The premise was simple. Pick one thing to do that you can do once each day that will make your life better. Then do it. For one hundred days. I chose to draw a comic every day. For a variety of reasons. Here are the results... This is a PDF eBook. You will receive an email with a download link shortly after purchase.

name: Crohns Comic (eBook)
description: "I thought it captured perfectly that discomfort/fear/anxiety that you have in the back of your mind in social situations" - Jeffrey Brown (Unlikely, Funny Misshapen Body) An auto-biographical comic about being diagnosed with Crohn's Disease at the age of eleven. The comic was produced during the 2007 24 hour comic challenge in which artists around the world attempted to complete 24 pages of a comic in 24 consecutive hours. No prior preparation was allowed. This is a PDF eBook. You will receive an email with a download link shortly after purchase.

name: How to Date a Girl in 10 Days (eBook)
description: "I'm a 33 year old man in a stable relationship and am about as sensitive as an extra-safe condom. How To Date A Girl In 10 days reminds me of when I wasn't - when fear of boys with guitars, of meta, of balloons, of everything filled my life and made it worth living - or, at least, made it the life I was living and I knew damn well I didn't have (or want) a choice. It's full of blessed friends who know nothing, blessed friends who are righter than you'll ever be and blessed, blessed London. It's funny and true and necessary" - Kieron Gillen (Phonogram, Uncanny X-Men) How to Date a Girl in 10 Days is an auto-biographical comic about love, loss, friendships, twenty-something dating, and paella. This is a PDF eBook. You will receive an email with a download link shortly after purchase.

name: Landscape Print
description:
An exclusive, limited edition print.

A3. On 325gsm uncoated paperstock (100% recycled and FSC certified)

Hand numbered and signed.

50 prints available.
